data.title: Fun community theater
data.text: I've been here many times. The actors always give their best to have the audience have a fabulous evening.

data.title: Great Production at a Community Theater!
data.text: We went for the first time to see The Red Velvet Cake War.  Outstanding performance, set design, sound and lighting.  I can't wait to see another performance!

data.title: Entertaining and Fun Evening
data.text:
Wife and I and another couple went to LTG Thursday evening Feb 4 to see The Red Velvet Cake War. The tickets were only $12 each. There is ample parking. The lobby is small and can get crowded easily. A very limited variety of refreshments are for sale in the lobby. We didn't try any of them, so don't know the pricing for the concessions. I have been to numerous productions here and they are yet to start on time. It seems they wait on the inconsiderate stragglers and late comers to be seated before beginning the show, ignoring the majority of patrons who are seated well before curtain time. But that is just a pet peeve of mine, I detest tardiness.
The production was well done. The acting, costumes and sets were excellent. All in all this was a very entertaining and fun evening at a very reasonable price.

data.title: Love it!!
data.text: I cannot say enough good things about this place! Every show sparks with talent and holds audiences in. I could come back night after night for any show!

data.title: Perfect Community Theatre!
data.text: Wow what great performances for a small Community Theatre!  It is small, cozy we loved that you could be so close to the stage no matter where you sat!  Drinks and snacks available (wine and beer too!) for purchase.. LOVE!

data.title: Little Theatre with a lot of talent
data.text: Hidden on a side street of Gastonia you will find talented performances from the local and not so local community. The Putnam County Spelling Bee was hysterical.  The actors were talented and gave wonderful performances. Please check out their website and participate in the next show.  You will be entertained.  Get adventuresome, invite friends and make a night or an afternoon of it.

data.title: A very intimate theatre
data.text: My son has been in several shows at this theatre and we love it.  It's big enough to feel like a "night out" but small enough to feel like you're really close to the actors.  Reasonably priced and very high quality performances.

data.title: great people great place.. wonderful talent
data.text: been many times .. never disappointed ..great actors giving all they are for great productions.. if you have never been you are missing out ..

data.title: Great place for the people of Gastonia
data.text: This is just a small place that regularly has plays of all types.  There is a lot of hard work that goes into these productions and I love to go!

data.title: What a great group of community actors
data.text: I have been to several productions over the last 3 years.  They do an amazing job! For such a small town it is packed with talent!  I love supporting this Little Theater!

data.title: Great theater!
data.text: I enjoyed the theater, I went during the day with family, and we all had a blast. I will surely recommend having other family members see this place!

data.title: Appreciate local talent and be part of your community
data.text: If you haven't been to the Little Theater lately, or at all, get with it. Right here in Gastonia you have dedicated theater goers who are supporting our local theater. Step out, get season tickets and enjoy a fun evening or afternoon production.

data.title: Excellent small theater experience
data.text: We have been attending performances for the past three years. We have seen musicals like Chicago to comedic and dramatic plays. All the performers are local actors and the sets are created by volunteers. The performances are reasonably priced and although the theater is small, the seating is comfortable. We highly recommend the little Theater of Gastonia for a fun evening!

data.title: Better than Average Community Theatre
data.text: This community theatre is supported by the United Arts Council of Gaston County, and staffed by volunteers, who work by day as professionals in our community.  Having served as a president of another arts council affiliate, I know that all the volunteers are stretched as far as possible to make things come together.  Perhaps there was nobody available to make popcorn and do all the other things which were required for a successful performance.  That being said, they might appreciate a volunteer to make and sell popcorn!  They do a great job, and the performances are well worth attending.

data.title: Cheap fun!
data.text: Great shows by local talent.  Could do better with refreshment stand.  How about some popcorn in the popcorn cart?
